reviews.text: I found Adam's Inn on the internet, and decided to stay here based on price. I had high hopes, but found it to be a mediocre B&B. We stayed in the basement suite with our 8 year old, and had plenty of room. NO complaints about the room....it was clean and roomy, and we had a small frig, which was nice since we like to save $ on food by eating in.
reviews.title: Won't stay again....

reviews.text: BUT.....what do you think about when you think B&B?????? Breakfast, right?!? Well, Adam's Inn needs help there....Here is what we had, 5 days in a row: toast, cereal, bagels, yogurt, apples, and the most terrible coffee ever! My 8 year old was happy with carbs galore, but I wanted something at least home made, instead of bread taken right out of a bag and put into a basket.
reviews.title: Amazing stay for a great price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Also, I wasn't too happy with the neighborhoods we had to walk thru to get to the metro station. Our first night, we were out late, and returned after 9pm. We felt uncomfortable, not in danger, but still.....from that night on, we made sure to be back at the hotel before dark. The walk from the metro station was about 20 minutes, a little too far with kids.
reviews.title: You get what you pay for.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Oh, and the high speed internet access was no-existent in our room....it did us no good!
reviews.title: Good location and price, but a few major problems

reviews.text: As I said, mediocre B&B at best. Clean, but poor breakfast and not so good location. I will not recomment it to friends.
reviews.title: Perfect little home away from home
Great Deal
reviews.text: Ideal location, walking distance to Dupont metro and restaurants. NIce breakfast.

My stay at Adams Inn was exactly as I expected it to be based on all the reviews I read on tripadviser. Clean, comfortable room (ours with a private bath...even on the third floor it had great water pressure and HOT water!), 10-15 minute walk to Metro, and a lean breakfast. I thought I'd be OK with a lean morning meal.
reviews.title: Old comment, new reviewer...

reviews.text: Turns out, "there's the rub"...I found the breakfast offering, like other reviewers, a little too meager and a sort of poor contrast to the day's full and exciting offerings from the city. I think the Inn's breakfast should offer besides all the carbs, a protein like eggs in the form of a quiche or scrambled eggs or even hard-boiled eggs.
reviews.title: Ok, but not great!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Vacation! It's fun! We save, and go, and hope for the best! Thanks Adams Inn for the clean room. Boy, it would have been so great to go downstairs to a more welcoming breakfast each morning. The BED was great, the BREAKFAST was, (sorry) poor. Hopefully you'll be able to catch up the breakfast to the accommodation and you'll be truly outstanding.
reviews.title: Cute cottage in the middle of the big city

reviews.text: Reading the previous reviews when booking this Inn it seemed like it was Four Star. The location was decent although I would not walk in the back alley by myself at night. We needed a room that could handle three people and were given a room on the third floor. Our mistake in not realizing this was the location of our room. It became a problem upon our arrival when we had to carry all our luggage, etc. up three flights. This was on top of the fact it was a very hot time in Washington running in the high 90's when we arrived and the Inn was not air conditioned in the hallways or any other part of the house other than our room. Also, the ac was not turned on prior to our arrival so our room was an oven and took a day to cool down.
reviews.title: Excellent B&B, great location.
uniquely quaint and convenient
reviews.text: Historic, yet humble building made us feel like we had a window into authentic D.C. lifestyles. If I'd known someone who'd welcomed me into their home in DC and it was that nice, I'd have felt privileged. Easy walking distance to exciting part of town while feeling apart from it's bustle if I preferred.

reviews.title: very enjoyable
reviews.text: We really enjoyed our stay at the Adam's Inn. We had a tiny room, but for our needs, it was perfect. Adam's Morgan is a great neighborhood, and a pleasant break from the Federal feel of DC closer to downtown. We walked everywhere and saw everything we wanted to see, and coming back to Adams Morgan in the evenings was a treat.

reviews.title: Rather shabby, impersonal and definitely overpriced.
reviews.text: The breakfast was good, but limited. Surprisingly there was no fruit and no wheat-free options, so if you're vegan and gluten-free, there's nothing there for you.

reviews.title: I can't wait to go back
reviews.text: We loved sitting in the garden at night. It's lovely.

reviews.title: Good Neighborhood Inn with Easy Transit Access
reviews.text: For the type of accomodations, home-style little bedrooms, it seemed a little pricey, but for DC, it was acceptable.

Adam's Inn offers good quality, a friendly staff, a good location (several blocks from the restaurants and shops in Adams Morgan) and a good price. This was my second time staying here, and I have liked it each time.
reviews.title: Good place to stay

reviews.text: The breakfast room offers a fair amount of goodies. I do wish, though, that breakfast would be available earlier than 8 a.m., though. I had to leave at 8:15 a.m. one day and had to scarf down my food.
reviews.title: lovely inn with character and very hospitable, friendly service

reviews.text: The Internet connection in the room was bad, even though I was told that it had been recently upgraded.
reviews.title: Adam's Inn was just like home!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In sum, be prepared to have to schlep your bags up the stairs and not get breakfast exactly when you may want it. But the inn offers a good value.
reviews.title: Lovely Stay - Great Value

reviews.text: I experienced great service here & my room was nice and comfortable. The inn is spread over three buildings (all right next to each other) and my building had a nice longue area, kitchen, and dining area on the ground level and a laundry in the basement. The breakfast was yummy (bagels, toast, cereal, oatmeal, fruit, yoghurt, coffee). The location was good - close to restaurants, starbucks etc and i felt safe in the neighbourhood (even when walking back from the metro station at night alone as a female). It's a ten-fifteen minute walk to the metro station but it's only a few stops to the centre of the action. I enjoyed my stay here and would definately stay here again.
reviews.title: Feel Like a DC Resident - Great Value
